title: [IODR] Get business trip via organization id
vulnerability_information:
Hi Uber,
I found issue on https://business.uber.com/server/organizations/[id]/trips2?per_page=15&requestAtStart=&requestAtStop=&count=true

Step to reproduce:
1. Get https://business.uber.com/server/organizations/[your_organization_id]/trips2?per_page=15&requestAtStart=&requestAtStop=&count=true
2. Chang to victim organization If valid id, it will return result, but if not it will show error with internal state 

```
{"error":{"name":"TchannelUnexpectedError","fullType":"tchannel.unexpected","type":"tchannel.unexpected","message":"Unexpected Error: 'validation_error.must_be_a_valid_uuid_v4'","isErrorFrame":true,"codeName":"UnexpectedError","errorCode":5,"originalId":2,"remoteAddr":"10.160.14.41:21306"}}
```
In `employee_invites`, it return 403.
As previous I report #151465 , I can get organization id or just enum it ( very difficult).

Best regards,
Severus
vulnerability_information_html:
Hi Uber,
I found issue on https://business.uber.com/server/organizations/%5Bid%5D/trips2?per_page=15&requestAtStart=&requestAtStop=&count=true

Step to reproduce:

  1. Get https://business.uber.com/server/organizations/%5Byour_organization_id%5D/trips2?per_page=15&requestAtStart=&requestAtStop=&count=true
  2. Chang to victim organization If valid id, it will return result, but if not it will show error with internal state 
{"error":{"name":"TchannelUnexpectedError","fullType":"tchannel.unexpected","type":"tchannel.unexpected","message":"Unexpected Error: 'validation_error.must_be_a_valid_uuid_v4'","isErrorFrame":true,"codeName":"UnexpectedError","errorCode":5,"originalId":2,"remoteAddr":"10.160.14.41:21306"}}

In employee_invites, it return 403.
As previous I report #151465 , I can get organization id or just enum it ( very difficult).

Best regards,
Severus

activities.message:
Thank you for your report.

I do see the different responses when providing a valid or invalid organization ID to this URL, but as you mentioned, it would be very difficult to enumerate organization IDs using this method.  You mentioned your previous report as a source for Organization IDs, but if you already have the Organization ID, what are you able to obtain at this endpoint?

Thanks, and good luck with your future bug hunting.
activities.markdown_message:
Thank you for your report.

I do see the different responses when providing a valid or invalid organization ID to this URL, but as you mentioned, it would be very difficult to enumerate organization IDs using this method. You mentioned your previous report as a source for Organization IDs, but if you already have the Organization ID, what are you able to obtain at this endpoint?

Thanks, and good luck with your future bug hunting.

activities.message: I know that it's diffcult to enumerate but with my #151465 I will get it from result of this issue via email, I will get trips history from other organization because it returns json, not html. In my #151465 will get organization info ( include user uuid, organization uuid and more).

In my #151465 will get organization info ( include user uuid, organization uuid and more).

activities.message:
Thanks for the follow up but I'm afraid we still don't see this posing a security risk. The information disclosed by using a victim's Organization ID only shows the following and it doesn't appear to be very sensitive:

`{"resources":[],"count":0,"hasNextPage":false,"page":0,"perPage":15,"filters":null}`

If you think we've missed something, please let us know and explain what information here can be used in an attack against other Uber users. 

Thanks and good luck in your future bug hunting.
activities.markdown_message:
Thanks for the follow up but I'm afraid we still don't see this posing a security risk. The information disclosed by using a victim's Organization ID only shows the following and it doesn't appear to be very sensitive:

{"resources":[],"count":0,"hasNextPage":false,"page":0,"perPage":15,"filters":null}

If you think we've missed something, please let us know and explain what information here can be used in an attack against other Uber users.

Thanks and good luck in your future bug hunting.

activities.message:
Hi rob, 
Has the Organization ID any record for the trips ? It should have one record for the trips, the result will be displayed.

activities.message: Can you reproduce this problem, bro ?

Thanks for the follow up. 

We're able to reproduce your findings except that we still don't actually see any sensitive data. All of our request only return `{"resources":[],"count":0,"hasNextPage":false,"page":0,"perPage":15,"filters":null}` when using a victim's Org ID. In your testing are you able to retrieve sensitive information? Can you provide us with a short video that demonstrates this? 

Thanks and good luck in your future bug hunting.
activities.markdown_message:

In your testing are you able to retrieve sensitive information? Can you provide us with a short video that demonstrates this?

Thanks and good luck in your future bug hunting.

activities.message:
I have no records for the trips for both victim and my organization id. I see that it uses org id to parser and then give result ( as your result) only. But I wonder why it didn't return 403 and Did it return some result if I had trip history ?
If you tested with victim's org id ( has trip history), and then no result returns,  I were wrong in this case.

activities.message: Can you add some trip history to huynhok.uit@vnoss.org' org ? I will retest with sample data from you.

activities.message:
Hi @severus,

I've confirmed that the `server/organizations/{{organization_uuid}}/trips2` endpoint is missing the expected authorization. I've triaged the issue internally, please have some patience while a fix is deployed.

Thanks!
activities.markdown_message:
Hi @severus,

I've confirmed that the server/organizations/{{organization_uuid}}/trips2 endpoint is missing the expected authorization. I've triaged the issue internally, please have some patience while a fix is deployed.

Thanks!

activities.message: I believe this issue has been fixed so I am closing this report as `Resolved`. Please take a moment to confirm and let us know if you do not agree. We have meetings every few weeks to discuss `Resolved` reports and we will follow up after the next one to determine if this submission was eligible under our bug bounty program. Thank you!

activities.message:
Hey @severus, we love it when hacker's want to write about their reports, absolutely! If you check our program page ([hackerone.com/uber](https://hackerone.com/uber)) we have a section specifically about this:

> ###Can I blog about my bug?
> Yes, but we ask that you wait until the issue is both fixed and paid out before you publish the blog post. We also prefer that you request disclosure through HackerOne so that readers of your blog post can get the full background on the issue.


We have the previously mentioned bounty meeting early next week when we'll decide on bounty eligibility for this report. Additionally, if you request public disclosure now (upper left of the comment box) we can discuss that in the same meeting early next week. Thanks!
activities.markdown_message:
Hey @severus, we love it when hacker's want to write about their reports, absolutely! If you check our program page (hackerone.com/uber) we have a section specifically about this:

Can I blog about my bug?

Yes, but we ask that you wait until the issue is both fixed and paid out before you publish the blog post. We also prefer that you request disclosure through HackerOne so that readers of your blog post can get the full background on the issue.

We have the previously mentioned bounty meeting early next week when we'll decide on bounty eligibility for this report. Additionally, if you request public disclosure now (upper left of the comment box) we can discuss that in the same meeting early next week. Thanks!

activities.message: Ah, I miss that section, sorry :)
As your mention, I request public disclose :)

activities.message:
Hi @Uber,
I see that #127161 had 5,000$ for bounty. He got infomation trips from other users with their uuids same as org's id of mine ( got uuids source from other attack as mine)
Did I miss somethings for getting higher bounty, bro ? I always respect your decision, but I see the impact is the same. 
Can I get any bonus for this endpoint ?
Best regards,
Severus

activities.message:
Hey @severus, sorry for the delayed response. Let me address your comments:

>I see that #127161 had 5,000$ for bounty. He got infomation trips from other users with their uuids same as org's id of mine ( got uuids source from other attack as mine)
> Did I miss somethings for getting higher bounty, bro ? I always respect your decision, but I see the impact is the same. 

The report in question was a different type of issue than the one reported here which had a higher impact. In this case it required a `organization_uuid` which is a mitigating factor compared to the report you mentioned.

> As your mention, I request public disclose :)

Sorry for the delay, this report slipped past me. Approving now :)

Thanks again for the report, looking forward to your next one!

As your mention, I request public disclose :)

Thanks again for the report, looking forward to your next one!
